class Solution:
    def minChanges(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> int:
        pair = list(zip(nums[:len(nums) // 2], nums[len(nums) // 2:][::-1]))
        # rans = []
        # for i, j in pair:
        #     rans.append((0, max(k-i, i), j-i))
        # min_range = max([i for i,j,k in rans])
        # max_range = min([j for i,j,k in rans])
        print(sorted(list(Counter([abs(i-j) for i,j in pair]).items()), key=lambda x: (-x[1], x[0])))
        guess_best = []
        guess_low = 99999999
        for a,b in sorted(list(Counter([abs(i-j) for i,j in pair]).items()), key=lambda x: (-x[1], x[0])):
            if not guess_best:
                guess_best.append((a,b))
                guess_low = a
            else:
                if a < guess_low:
                    guess_low = a
                    guess_best.append((a,b))
                
        res = []
        for a,b in guess_best:
            cnt = 0
            for i, j in pair:
                if abs(i-j) == a:
                    pass
                elif max(max(k-i, i, k-j), i, j) < a:
                    cnt += 2
                else:
                    cnt += 1
            res.append(cnt)
        print(guess_best, res)
        return min(res)
